content.description:
Sit start with left hand in Mittens McLean crack and right hand on the sidepull arret.  Go straight up using crack, sidepulls, heel hook and all kinds of good tricks.

See topo photo
Crash pad.

Sit/squat start on the rail at the far right. Traverse the slopey rail to the corner and top out.

Sector Six boulder, on the far right side of the rock facing the forrest.
A single pad would be fine.  This problem is pretty short, so falls aren't a big issue.

A bit of an eliminate, but still a worthy line.  Sit start on the far right rail and traverse left (same as Hen Night).  At the crease continue left, into the crack, avoiding the top lip of the boulder.  Get both hands in the crack and make the difficult, if not painful, move across the blank space to join Speakeasy and top out. 

Sector Six, on the side facing the forrest.  This line transverses the full lenght of the boulder, avoiding the lip until the very end.
The entire crux can be comfortably covered by 1 pad.

Start low under the bulge, right hand on a small crimp with a good thumb catch, left hand on an undercling by your feet.  Pull off the ground and make a hard slap over the first roof with your left to a sloping side-pull.  Bust out right, bumping your way up bad slopers to a hard pinch.  Grab the good crimps in the middle of the face.  From here its straight up and over the last lip to a rewarding finish. 
  
 Standing start at the good crimps checks in around V5.

Sector Six, just to the right of the slabs you see on the approach.
Good flat landing.  A big pad would be helpful, as you travel a long way out.

Drop yourself down into the pit to a sitting position. Left hand starts on a decent crimp, right hand on a sloping gaston.  Punch straight up the prow using small crimps, side pulls and underclings.  
  
 Bring a brush, this wall seems to grow lichen and moss fast!  Top out is always dusty.

North, northwest side of Sector Six, on the wall facing up toward Yamnuska.  There is a boulder resting agaist the face.  Problems starts on the right side of this boulder, down below.
2 pads, one down low and another for the second step up. Spotter is a must to keep you from raking your back as you come out from the depths.

Sit start in the obvious Crack in the side facing the forrest.  Go straight up and top out.  Short and sweet!

Sector Six.  See topo photo.
Crash pad

Start in the left end of the roof with right hand in a hole-like feature. Pull the roof onto the slab, delicate work to the anchor.



Left of Hey Sailor, just below the roof before the slabby section of the Boulder

Pads and balls for the balancey finish

Climb up the groove on the left side of the north block

See topo photo
Crash pad and spotter
High quality boulder, solid rock and great setting.  Home to one of the best problems in the rockies, Hey Sailor.
